smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'EntryRecyclerAdapter' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'PgpActivity' with '24' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'PasswordEntry' with '14' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Object 'Companion' with '12' functions detected. Defined threshold inside objects is set to '11'
Class 'AutofillService' with '18' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'UserPreference' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'PasswordStore' with '28' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'GitActivity' with '18' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function onCreateDialog is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function onCreateDialog is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function onCreatePreferences is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class PgpActivity is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class AutofillService is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class PrefsFragment is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class PasswordStore is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class GitActivity is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ObjectPropertyNaming
smells.description: Property names inside objects should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Private object property names should match the pattern: (_)?[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]*
Private object property names should match the pattern: (_)?[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]*
Private object property names should match the pattern: (_)?[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: VariableNaming
smells.description: Variable names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Variable names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: MatchingDeclarationName
smells.description: If a source file contains only a single non-private top-level class or object, the file name should reflect the case-sensitive name plus the .kt extension.

instances.message: The file name 'SshKeygenTask.kt' does not match the name of the single top-level declaration 'KeyGenerateTask'.

smells.name: MemberNameEqualsClassName
smells.description: A member should not given the same name as its parent class or object.

instances.message: A member is named after the class object. This might result in confusion. Please rename the member.

smells.name: SpreadOperator
smells.description: Using a spread operator causes a full copy of the array to be created before calling a method has a very high performance penalty.

Using a spread operator causes a full copy of the array to be created before calling a method has a very high performance penalty.
Using a spread operator causes a full copy of the array to be created before calling a method has a very high performance penalty.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (canEdit.not()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: canEdit.not()
Parentheses in (pathname.isDirectory && pathname.isHidden) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: pathname.isDirectory && pathname.isHidden
Parentheses in (dialog!!.findViewById<CheckBox>(R.id.numerals)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: dialog!!.findViewById<CheckBox>(R.id.numerals)
Parentheses in (dialog!!.findViewById<CheckBox>(R.id.symbols)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: dialog!!.findViewById<CheckBox>(R.id.symbols)
Parentheses in (dialog!!.findViewById<CheckBox>(R.id.uppercase)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: dialog!!.findViewById<CheckBox>(R.id.uppercase)
Parentheses in (dialog!!.findViewById<CheckBox>(R.id.ambiguous)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: dialog!!.findViewById<CheckBox>(R.id.ambiguous)
Parentheses in (dialog!!.findViewById<CheckBox>(R.id.pronounceable)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: dialog!!.findViewById<CheckBox>(R.id.pronounceable)
Parentheses in (dialog!!.findViewById<CheckBox>(R.id.lowercase)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: dialog!!.findViewById<CheckBox>(R.id.lowercase)
Parentheses in (requireActivity() as PasswordStore) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: requireActivity() as PasswordStore
Parentheses in (hotpCounter!!) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: hotpCounter!!
Parentheses in (other is PasswordItem) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: other is PasswordItem
Parentheses in (other.file == file) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: other.file == file

Parentheses in (event.eventType == AccessibilityEvent.TYPE_WINDOW_CONTENT_CHANGED &&
                        event.packageName != null &&
                        (event.packageName == "com.android.chrome" || event.packageName == "com.android.browser")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: event.eventType == AccessibilityEvent.TYPE_WINDOW_CONTENT_CHANGED &&
                        event.packageName != null &&
                        (event.packageName == "com.android.chrome" || event.packageName == "com.android.browser")
Parentheses in (pwFlags and PasswordGenerator.LOWERS == 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: pwFlags and PasswordGenerator.LOWERS == 0
Parentheses in (pwFlags and PasswordGenerator.UPPERS) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: pwFlags and PasswordGenerator.UPPERS
Parentheses in (pwgenFlags and UPPERS) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: pwgenFlags and UPPERS
Parentheses in (pwgenFlags and LOWERS) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: pwgenFlags and LOWERS

Parentheses in (!Character.isISOControl(c) &&
                    block != null && block !== UnicodeBlock.SPECIALS) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: !Character.isISOControl(c) &&
                    block != null && block !== UnicodeBlock.SPECIALS

Parentheses in (serverUser.text.toString() +
                            "@" +
                            serverUrl.text.toString().trim { it <= ' ' } +
                            ":") are unnecessary and can be replaced with: serverUser.text.toString() +
                            "@" +
                            serverUrl.text.toString().trim { it <= ' ' } +
                            ":"

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.
